member.name: T:TK.CustomMap.Utilities.GmsMathUtils
member.summary: This is a java to c# port from https://github.com/googlemaps/android-maps-utils/blob/dba3b0d8a9657ebab8c67a4f50bd731437a229bc/library/src/com/google/maps/android/MathUtil.java

member.name: M:TK.CustomMap.Utilities.GmsMathUtils.Clamp(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Restrict x to the range [low, high].

member.name: M:TK.CustomMap.Utilities.GmsMathUtils.Wrap(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Wraps the given value into the inclusive-exclusive interval between min and max.

member.name: M:TK.CustomMap.Utilities.GmsMathUtils.Mod(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the non-negative remainder of x / m.

member.name: M:TK.CustomMap.Utilities.GmsMathUtils.Mercator(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns mercator Y corresponding to latitude. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mercator_projection .

member.name: M:TK.CustomMap.Utilities.GmsMathUtils.InverseMercator(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns latitude from mercator Y.

member.name: M:TK.CustomMap.Utilities.GmsMathUtils.Hav(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns haversine(angle-in-radians). hav(x) == (1 - cos(x)) / 2 == sin(x / 2)^2.

member.name: M:TK.CustomMap.Utilities.GmsMathUtils.ArcHav(System.Double)
member.summary: Computes inverse haversine. Has good numerical stability around 0. arcHav(x) == acos(1 - 2 * x) == 2 * asin(sqrt(x)). The argument must be in [0, 1], and the result is positive.

member.name: M:TK.CustomMap.Utilities.GmsMathUtils.SinFromHav(System.Double)
member.summary: Given h==hav(x), returns sin(abs(x)).

member.name: M:TK.CustomMap.Utilities.GmsMathUtils.HavFromSin(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns hav(asin(x))

member.name: M:TK.CustomMap.Utilities.GmsMathUtils.SinSumFromHav(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns sin(arcHav(x) + arcHav(y)).

member.name: M:TK.CustomMap.Utilities.GmsMathUtils.HavDistance(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns hav() of distance from (lat1, lng1) to (lat2, lng2) on the unit sphere.

member.name: T:TK.CustomMap.Utilities.GmsPolyUtil
member.summary: This is a java to c# port from https://github.com/googlemaps/android-maps-utils/blob/dba3b0d8a9657ebab8c67a4f50bd731437a229bc/library/src/com/google/maps/android/PolyUtil.java

member.name: M:TK.CustomMap.Utilities.GmsPolyUtil.TanLatGC(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns tan(latitude-at-lng3) on the great circle (lat1, lng1) to (lat2, lng2). lng1==0. See http://williams.best.vwh.net/avform.htm .

member.name: M:TK.CustomMap.Utilities.GmsPolyUtil.MercatorLatRhumb(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns mercator(latitude-at-lng3) on the Rhumb line (lat1, lng1) to (lat2, lng2). lng1==0.

member.name: M:TK.CustomMap.Utilities.GmsPolyUtil.Intersects(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Computes whether the vertical segment (lat3, lng3) to South Pole intersects the segment (lat1, lng1) to (lat2, lng2). Longitudes are offset by -lng1; the implicit lng1 becomes 0.

member.name: M:TK.CustomMap.Utilities.GmsPolyUtil.ContainsLocation(Xamarin.Forms.Maps.Position,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Xamarin.Forms.Maps.Position},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Computes whether the given point lies inside the specified polygon. The polygon is always cosidered closed, regardless of whether the last point equals the first or not. Inside is defined as not containing the South Pole -- the South Pole is always outside. The polygon is formed of great circle segments if geodesic is true, and of rhumb (loxodromic) segments otherwise.

member.name: M:TK.CustomMap.Utilities.GmsPolyUtil.IsLocationOnEdge(Xamarin.Forms.Maps.Position,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Xamarin.Forms.Maps.Position},System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Computes whether the given point lies on or near the edge of a polygon, within a specified tolerance in meters. The polygon edge is composed of great circle segments if geodesic is true, and of Rhumb segments otherwise. The polygon edge is implicitly closed -- the closing segment between the first point and the last point is included.

member.name: M:TK.CustomMap.Utilities.GmsPolyUtil.IsLocationOnEdge(Xamarin.Forms.Maps.Position,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Xamarin.Forms.Maps.Position},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Same as with a default tolerance of 0.1 meters.

member.name: M:TK.CustomMap.Utilities.GmsPolyUtil.IsLocationOnPath(Xamarin.Forms.Maps.Position,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Xamarin.Forms.Maps.Position},System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Computes whether the given point lies on or near a polyline, within a specified tolerance in meters. The polyline is composed of great circle segments if geodesic is true, and of Rhumb segments otherwise. The polyline is not closed -- the closing segment between the first point and the last point is not included.

member.name: M:TK.CustomMap.Utilities.GmsPolyUtil.IsLocationOnPath(Xamarin.Forms.Maps.Position,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Xamarin.Forms.Maps.Position},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Same as with a default tolerance of 0.1 meters.

member.name: M:TK.CustomMap.Utilities.GmsPolyUtil.IsLocationOnPath(Xamarin.Forms.Maps.Position,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Xamarin.Forms.Maps.Position},System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the tolerence by zoom/center latitude http://www.programcreek.com/java-api-examples/index.php?api=com.google.maps.android.PolyUtil

member.name: M:TK.CustomMap.Utilities.GmsPolyUtil.SinDeltaBearing(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns sin(initial bearing from (lat1,lng1) to (lat3,lng3) minus initial bearing from (lat1, lng1) to (lat2,lng2)).

member.name: T:TK.CustomMap.Utilities.GmsSphericalUtil
member.summary: This is a java to c# port from https://github.com/googlemaps/android-maps-utils/blob/dba3b0d8a9657ebab8c67a4f50bd731437a229bc/library/src/com/google/maps/android/SphericalUtil.java

member.name: M:TK.CustomMap.Utilities.GmsSphericalUtil.ComputeOffset(Xamarin.Forms.Maps.Position,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the LatLng resulting from moving a distance from an origin in the specified heading (expressed in degrees clockwise from north).
member.param: The LatLng from which to start.
The heading in degrees clockwise from north.
